name: Reef View Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed at the Reef View for 3 nights on the 6th floor the room was neat and fairly plain but the view out from the room on the Balcony was just magical. The rooms are really big and spacious the only thing that went wrong was when they cleaned my room they lost my tv remote but once i told staff they were very quick to rectify the situation. I would definietly stay here again if I come back to Hamilton Island. October is such a beautiful time to see the island last time we went it bucketed with rain the whole time make sure you check all the weather guides for the time of year your going.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed My Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying here for 5 days, its a wonderful part of the world to stay, and this hotel is great..The rooms are very big and well set out.The storage space is lacking no draws for clothes a couple of cupboards to put your clothes. but if thats all thats wrong here we're laughing.People throughout the resort are helpful and friendly.The free shuffle bus can take you around the island or down to the Marina where there are wonderful restaurants of all levels. Great free water sports as well as others you pay for. Great for families as the pool here is long but the other lagoon pool over towards the beach has a swim up pool bar..all in all heaven...
reviews.title: Beautiful relaxing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Wow, we couldn't believe the view from our room on the 19th floor!
reviews.title: What an amazing view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the two balconies with opening doors. Also were very impressed with the sound proofing. There were quite a few weddings and some had loud music late into the night. We were amazed that we couldn't hear a sound when we shut the doors!
reviews.title: Great hotel. Can get extremely busy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds were great and the bathroom was huge - biggest one I've seen in a hotel!
reviews.title: Thank you for a wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from Hamilton Island after celebrating our 10th Wedding Anniversary. We stayed in a suite at the Reef View Hotel. The overall experience was great.
reviews.title: Fabulous Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only complaints I have are that the rooms are starting to show some wear and tear. The tiles in the bathroom are a bit stained, and the walls could stand a new coat of paint. The room was clean and functional and the view from our room on the 19th floor was breathtaking!!
reviews.title: Great views, but pricey

likes.liked: — The views and the recently renovated rooms
likes.disliked: — The renovation work going on below us which caused all sorts of noise in the middle of the day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were great and always helpful. The 2 guys at the lobby bar are a terrific fun. A wonderful selection is available at the buffet breakfast. If you don't get the chance to eat dinner at the Pool Terrace Restaurant, don't worry, it was a great disappointment and certainly not worth the money.
reviews.title: Beautiful but weather variable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hamilton Island is very expensive, be prepared. I would certainly return though, it's a faulous spot. You must see Whitehaven Beach if nothing else.
reviews.title: Amazing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had originally been booked to stay at Palm Terrace, but upon arrival had found this accomodation to be downright appalling. We then paid the extra GBP 25 per night to upgrade to the Reef View Hotel - smartest decision we ever made! For the extra money, the Reef View Hotel is 100 times nicer than the Palm Terrace / Bungalows. If you are debating between the two, do not even think about it another minute and just pay the extra for the Reef View Hotel - you will not regret it!
reviews.title: Unhelpful Reception

likes.liked: — The room was lovely and spacious

reviews.title: Relaxing but busy in the whitsundays
reviews.text: Left Sydney on Thursday morning, was checked in at the Reef View and in our room by lunchtime, loving the view of the turquoise water and leafy surrounds and ready to try one of the many restaurants on the island for a relaxing lunch. The hotel looks dated from the outside and lobby area however the room was spacious, modern, clean and very comfortable. The beds were especially good, and the bathroom was large and had a separate shower. Staff were very efficient and friendly on the island. Prices seemed high but I guess you expect that in a remote location. There's lots to do on Hamilton, liked the large pool and the free non-motorised watersports - gave kyaking and sailing a try on the last day. Our favourite restaurant was Co Ca Chu for dinner, very yummy asian food, but in demand so do book ahead. The island wasn't over-run by families but was busy (seemed to be 2 weddings per day) and this wasn't even peak season. Really enjoyed the break and getting out of the city for 5 days.

reviews.title: breakfast by the sea
reviews.text: This is a large resort hotel but the rooms are spacious and the staff helpful. The buffet breakfast by the sea at Sails is very picture post card and the lamingtons are a delightful indulgence. While there was some noise from the bar each night, things were closed and quiet by 11:30 pm.

reviews.title: Business with a little bit of pleasure
reviews.text: Great sized rooms, with a brilliant view - close to everything. Slightly overpriced food, but accomodation and drinks were about where you'd expect them to be.You can eat and drink at the majority of bars and restaurants and charge it back to your room, not just within the hotel itself

reviews.title: Paradise!
reviews.text: We are a recently retired couple and were part way through a month long holiday from UK. The arrival at Hamilton Island is spectacular as the small runway has both ends in the ocean, so the pilot needs to do a pinpoint landing! The transfer from the airport to hotel takes only a few minutes, and the baggage is handled by the resort porters/concierge. Check-in was smooth and efficient. Our bags were brought to our room around 10 minutes after we had checked in.

reviews.title: Beautiful Whitsundays
reviews.text: The room was excellent - large, spacious with one wall consisting of a patio window, leading to a small balcony with lovely views over the ocean. The twin beds were each queen sized and very comfortable. There is no complimentary in-room WiFi, but there is complimentary WiFi in the hotel lobby, bar and in the resort centre.

reviews.title: Nice but expensive stay....
reviews.text: Stayed at the reef view for 4 nights. June still a good time to travel as not too hot during the days. Hotel was as expected. Not overly modern but large spacious rooms. I had a 'garden view room' but still had nad nice views over the ocean. Try and get a room on 4th floor to 'clear' the trees.

reviews.title: Great hotel with nice views and excellent service
reviews.text: Didnt have breakfast but food was very good although a little pricey. However thats better than paying very little for bad quality food.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Don't Pay Full Price
reviews.text: The best and cheapest option was the fish n chip option. $10 for really good fish and chips. very nice!

reviews.title: A great hotel with trooms that have the most amazing views
reviews.text: Golf buggys are a little expensive however a good idea to hire maybe on the 1st day so you can get you're bearings, and have a little wonder around the island. Great staff!

reviews.title: Loved it, can't wait to return!
reviews.text: Stay in the Reef View Hotel for a work conference here in Jun 2009. My room is 1101.

reviews.title: Absolutely loved it....
reviews.text: Yes, we absolutely loved Reef View Hotel & Hamilton Island.

reviews.title: We loved the hotel
reviews.text: From the time we landed, our luggage and check in was very organised and smooth. Coach transfer to the hotel. We arrived at approx 12.30pm and our room was available 30 minutes later. Bags were in our room already upon arrival.

reviews.title: Reef view hotel got our thumbs up!
reviews.text: The renovations to the room are well done. We were on the 17th floor (after having requested a high floor upon booking directly with the hotel) and the view was brilliant. Bathroom is very large with two basins, deep bath and separate toilet. Our room had two queen size beds to accomodate our little one. Flat screen tv, small table and chairs and two small lounge chairs.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: The hotel itself has a very nice pool, tour desk where we booked our trips, great glass elevators where you can take in the view, a bar, small convenience store.

reviews.title: I love Hamilton island
reviews.text: Takes about 5 minutes to walk to the beach and about 10 minutes to the marina. We hired a buggy for 2 days of our stay and got around the whole island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our arrival from the airport via the shuttle was efficient and informative and this settled our apprehension on entering the Reef View Hotel having read a number of reviews containing many problems.
reviews.title: Problem?What Problem?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These in fact had made me wish I had booked elsewhere.
reviews.title: Nice place.. food was too expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Check in was like clockwork with my wife and I on the 17th floor King Bed Room within a few moments of our arrival.
reviews.title: Reef View Almost Famous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The balcony view is sensational the room is appointed with nice furnishings and plenty of space for relaxing
reviews.title: Hotel in need of a desperate renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cupboard or drawer storage is lacking so we lived out of our suitcases generally.
reviews.title: better than the postcard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from this 12th floor room were amazing. There were two double beds, a large bathroom with shower and bath, plenty of storage space, and small but very adequate seating area. Of course, the sea facing balcony was a real bonus.Complimentary tea/coffee/toiletries replaced daily, room service very efficient. We had breakfast included, which was excellent, giving great choices of food and as much as you can eat. This set us up for the day. General food prices are high so we didn't need to snack out after breakfast. The restaurant at the Reef View is a bit over priced,and menu choice a little limited but quality and service was good. Tv signal was weak and at times non existent, this was a problem all over the island, however, there was no DVD player provided as an alternative to TV for those rare moments when relaxing in front of the box would have been good. In other hotels this was provided so that we could hire a film from the local shop. Films were available from the Reef hotel in-house channel, but were very expensive. The swimming pool was clean and quite large, with plenty of sun loungers. Hotel staff were helpful, very polite and well organised. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Amazing views and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a good hotel on Hamilton Island - opened in 1990 but is hiding it's age well. Rooms are spacious and beds very comfortable. The views are amazing - but to get the best ones you'd have to be above floor 8. However would not pay full price ($450 AS) to return - search around for a deal as I and another guest paid approx. $250. Staff are very friendly (as they are across the island) and the reef pool although smalll feels modern (with comfy sun beds). Location is great (5-10 min stroll to the marina and beach). Overall safe option if you can secure a good deal online.
reviews.title: Good value and great views - but don't pay full price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved Hamilton Island, probably one of the best holiday places to visit for a short stay to do as much or little of whatever you want to recharge the batteries. We stayed on the 8th floor facing the beach - view was stunning. We where next to the elevator shafts which you could hear going through the day but I did not hear them at night whilst sleeping. The birds on Hamilton can be a bit noisy (Curlew's call has to be heard to be believed). Sulphur Crested cockatoos think they run the place but for me this added to the experience and I loved it all the wildlife! Our room was clean, staff were friendly and pool, especially the reef centre lagoon were magnificent. Only one criticism I had was we did not have a breakfast included in our room rate so had to line up with the rest then move to another podium to deal with this issue, only one staff to deal with this issue hence the queue would start to back up. This system needs to be addressed, one podium to deal with the lot or two staff, cleary marked podiums to streamline entry to what was an excellent brekkie - birds and all:)
reviews.title: Reef view with emphasis on the View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel is located in good location, only minutes from marina, restaurants and airport, which you would expect as it is a small island. Check-in was very good and staff were efficient and helpful. Ask for a room on a high floor ocean-facing to take advantage of magnificent views. Room was tired and not really that clean, dailt room clean was also very poor, as I expect they only made the bed and gave the bathroom a once over. Breakfast was average, but not bad, just lacked quality of food, given the price of room. Staff in general were very hit and miss, some excellent, some totally disinterested. Birds are a real menace on your own balcony(never leave door open) and pool area, where they are constantly stealing food. One evening we lost water to whole hotel, rang every dept in hotel and not one answer, had to go downstairs and complain and they didn't seem that bothered. On checkout staff were poor and over-charged, upon request of details, they could not prove what was charged, seemed quite dodgy. Eventually amount taken from account, only to find the next day the hotel charged me again. NOT GOOD ENOUGH! I would stay somewhere else, perhaps an apartment, villa or holiday home. Just seems poorly managed overall and quite expensive for what it really is.
reviews.title: Trouble In Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: We were travelling for business and my partner and I were looking forward to staying in this hotel. Unfortunately due to the lack of service (or enthusiasm to assist) by the hotel manager and some of the front desk staff this dampened our experience. I/we couldn't help but feel that the hotel had the attitude of "we have your money now... Work it out yourself".
reviews.title: Four star hotel... Where is the service?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Aesthetically every aspect of the property is lovely, and the very tasteful refurbishment project completed a few years earlier has added a contemporary freshness to this resort. The bed and pillow quality were exemplary, and why shouldn't they be, a hotel room is largely for sleeping in.
reviews.title: 4 star property, with 5 star service and staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: From check-in to house-keeping to bell desk, staff demeanour and courtesy were splendid, and with a characteristic amiability that Aussies possess.
reviews.title: Fab long weekend away with the girls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Congratulations Mr Boileau, to you and your staff.
reviews.title: family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a 4 night stay at the reef view hotel. We had a ball, A place where you can do as much or as little as you like. The included buffet breakfast was fantastic, such a good selection of food - you could eat at three different places on the island with the 'included' breakfast which made for a lovely change of scenery.... Remember to keep your deck/balcony doors closed..... otherwise the birds come in and make a mess :P The room was tidy and clean, the bathrooms need a bit of an update but clean all the same and large which is great when three girls are sharing! Loved that the porters sorted all of your bags at both check in and check out - didn't have to lift a finger. Excellent having the free shuttles all the time. The hotel staff were always friendly with advice on where to go, eat etc. We all had a lovely treatment at the day spa on the island and all of us were very very happy, all receiving excellent treatments!
reviews.title: 5 day break away with friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: family holiday with our boys (6 and 10)
reviews.title: Very Family Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Hamilton Island and taken straight to our hotel. Checkin was fine.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool at Reef View was lovely too.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the reef view

likes.disliked: — The noise from the lift - we could hear it from our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a big choice for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Place!

likes.liked: — The views over the Witsundays and the friendly cockatoo's that came to visit :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: There was a few cool restaurants; a steak house, fish restaurant, sports bar, pizza restaurant and a few others. Night life shut off about 11.30pm but we never made it that late we found it really humid.
reviews.title: Loved the Reef View Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of our best times was hiring a golf buggy and going round the island, we brought a picnic and went up to one tree hill to see the amazing views.
reviews.title: A little disappointed...

likes.liked: — hmmmm.....the size of the room probably
likes.disliked: — needing to pay for EVERYTHING additional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I found this hotel overrated and boring. The room are average and has no charm. The bathrooms are old looking and where not very clean. The worst was the food...the same buffet EVERY night. If you wanted to eat something else you had to leave the hotel and go to the harbor and it was located far from the hotel you had to to rent a golf cart or walk (big hills and not fun with kids) or you could wait for a minibus, but it was always full or took forever to come. Before you get here you think you can snorkel and swim in the ocean but when you get in to the hotel room you get a paper saying that there are stingers and that they recommend you to swim in the pool all the time! It was just a let down. The only nice thing is the glassed in elevator which gives you a nice view every ride but you have to wait...a long time for them to come.
reviews.title: A disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet did not work for 4 days and the gym has no air-condition just fans=very hot. We are traveling around the world for 1 year so I have stayed at a lot of places and this one was a let down.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and well run

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights and from the moment you arrive at the airport, things were very efficient with bags being collected, bus transfer and check in. We only booked a Garden View room, and were on the 2nd floor facing the entrance, if you want a good view you have to book the Ocean View room.
reviews.title: lovely place--pity service isnt great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is one of the biggest I have stayed in, and the bathroom is also huge. The shower is probably one of the best you will get anywhere, the power was amazing. The room was pretty clean, only complaint is that some areas were a bit dusty.
reviews.title: Poor service and no view
Hamilton Island more like motor mower island
reviews.text: I personally didn't notice the buggy noise, but would prefer that to car traffic noise. Although, it was very quiet on the island with Jan and Feb being the tropical season, so be aware, not much to do when it's raining the whole time. The restaurants and room service are quite pricey, but they have a captive market, the bakery and supermarket at the harbour are good alternatives.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I looked at this website before I booked at the Reef View Hotel and just assumed some of the negative comments were probably a bit on the overdone side....
reviews.title: Reef View Hotel - we were dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not so!!!!!!
reviews.title: Loved The Reef View

likes.liked: — Fantastic views of the ocean for every room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Island to be expensive and catered towards getting you to spend your money.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings on the Reef View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Island is all run by the same group but they name the restaurants differently to make you think you have some choice.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the Hotel, all seemed well to begin with. But we quickly changed our mind. The hotel room didnt look like it had been cleaned. The shower had mildew/mould. The bathtub/spa had a dirty black ring around it. Not very romantic for honeymooners....One of the beds smelled funny and at first we couldnt think why...the only way to describe the smell is urine!!! Luckily for us there was another bed in the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay - loved the Reef View Hotel!

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious room with a gorgeous balcony view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To celebrate our 7th wedding anniversary Jase and I took a trip to Hamilton Island. Last time we were here we stayed in a Palm Bungalow so thought we'd upgrade to the Reef View Hotel this time. Well we are so glad we did! The entire establishment is beautiful, filled with friendly staff and had us oohing and ahhing from the minute we arrived to the moment we left. We stayed on the 11th floor and had unobstructed views of the ocean and resort below. Our room was spacious with 2 queen size beds, a large balcony, flat screen TV with Foxtel and in-house new release movies, a large marble bathroom with huge tub separate toilet and a shower big enough for the two of us! The room rate included a full buffet breakfast each and we couldn't believe what was on offer when we arrived at the restaurant each morning. Bacon, eggs (cooked to your liking), sausages, hash browns, grilled tomatoes, mushrooms, spaghetti, baked beans, toast, pancakes, fruit, cereals, yoghurts, the list goes on! The hotel pool was olympic size and one of many pools on the island that we enjoyed taking a refreshing dip in. The main resort pool is enormous and has an island bar that serves delicious cocktails during happy hour each day. We hired a buggy during our stay and had fun cruising around taking in the sights, snapping photos and stopping to admire the amazing views. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from including one on the ground floor of the Reef View Hotel but The Steakhouse and Italian Restaurant on the Marina get a big thumbs up from us. Both served delicious food that left us wanting more and tasted as good as the water views surrounding them! We ordered room service from the Reef View Hotel late one evening (around 11pm) and our order was delivered within 10 minutes and tasted great. The staff were friendly and helpful, which made check-in/check-out quick and easy. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Reef View Hotel at Hamilton Island to anyone looking to take a relaxing (and romantic) break. We've already made plans to return again later this year only next time we'll be staying a lot longer!
reviews.title: Can't wait to return to the Reef View Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: After our terrible experience at Brampton Island we were very anxious as to what we would find at Hamilton Island and it exceeded our expectations. The Hotel was fantastic, nice big rooms, clean, great views over the reef, friendly staff and the buffet breakfast was incredible. We really enjoyed our stay there and would not hesitate to recommend it. The little village with its many restaurants makes for great variety and choice of meals. The bush walks are nice, although they do need some maintenance after the wet season.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009
reviews.text: Stayed at the Reef View Hotel as part of a group. The hotel was awesome! Big rooms with lovely views of the ocean and the surrounding areas. The staff were friendly and helpful, and went out of their way to make our stay trouble free. Got to the hotel identified our luggage, and when we arrived in our room, our luggage was there. The swimming pool was big, and it was a nice place to relax and take in the atmosphere. Having the bar and the restaurant located on site, and right next to the pool area, made our short stay enjoyable, meaning that everything you needed was right there.
reviews.title: My choice of THE place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free shuttle arrives at the front door to take you to various places on the island, and comes at regular times. Wait times are not that long. The island itself is small, making everything within walking distance, however you are able to hire golf cares to transport you around. Right next door there is a sports centre which has a gym in it, and the services there are complimentary to the guests staying at the Reef View Hotel. It is equipped with modern equipment, and although it does not have air conditioning, who really cares when you get to use the gym for nothing.
reviews.title: Fantastic large rooms with an amazing view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I totally enjoyed our stay a the reef view hotel. Staff were friendly and poliet. Rooms were very large and spotlessly clean. Our room also had a great view over the swimming pool out to the ocean. Breakfast which was included in the package deal included all you would expect from a full buffet and was very tasty. We would stay again for sure!
reviews.title: I didn't want to leave!!!

description: The Reef View Hotel features 364 extremely spacious, well-appointed rooms all with private balconies overlooking either landscaped gardens or the breathtaking vista of the Coral Sea. The upper-most floors boast 18 luxuriously appointed suites. All rooms face the sea complete with outdoor furniture to experience the spectacular sunrises and sunsets. Additional Reef View Hotel facilities include the Pool Terrace restaurant, Reef Lounge bar and Tour Desk.
